name: nonforfeitable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A nonforfeitable benefit (= something that an employee receives in addition to money) is one that they will always have the right to claim: At normal retirement age, all benefits payable under this pension plan are nonforfeitable. The pension scheme member has a nonforfeitable right to this portion.
More examplesFewer examplesThe loan must be less than half the nonforfeitable accrued benefit under the plan. Upon the plan's termination, the rights of all affected employees to benefits accrued to the date of such termination shall be nonforfeitable. They were entitled to an immediate non-forfeitable annual pension.
